column4: guys, I was trying to add new fonts and in the process I end up crashing all of the gnome login
need help
the only notable info in my X org log is: Could not init font path element /usr/share/fonts/X11/TTF/, removing from list!
Could not init font path element /usr/share/fonts/X11/OTF, removing from list!
Could not init font path element /usr/share/fonts/X11/CID/, removing from list!
anyone willing to help me out?
I just want to reset all of the font stuff to their original places, how do I do this?
how did you change them
was following this guide: http://www.taimila.com/ubuntuosx.php
I*
777 is NOT
that changes the group too
he said just the user - not a group
/msg
undo the guide you followed
undo what you have done - for the last time
yes it is
sounds like it may be easier to install
why not what ?
because if you don't know what you're doing it can wreck your whole system
what makes you think its noapci ?
don't make random guesses with the kernel
not its not - it changes the way your kernel deals with apci requests
that is a reasonable deal
